column4: does someone know why the toggle fullscreen shortcut doesn't work in some cases ?
toogle full-screen in which application?
in no specific application, just in any application. Most of them should allow that, there's a system shortcut for that.
it's in system configuration->keyboard->shortcuts->window->toggle fullscreen
It's disabled on my Precise install. I don't think anything responds to the event.
well I have this working on one computer
If you hold down the Super key (often the Windows key) you'll get a menu of available key shortcuts
Same version of Ubuntu on the other PC?
yes you're right there's no default shortcut assigned to it, but you can assign one. I did so. And it worked on one pc, not on the other.
yes both 12.04 lts x64 desktop edition.
one is a laptop (the one that doesn't work).
Then something else has probably bound to the same keypress first... that used to be an issue with older gnome installations... trying to find out what was grabbing the keypress first
and also, one is using 2d, the other 3d
and which one won't do full-screen? 3D ?
yes
the laptop, with unity 3d, doesn't do fullscreen.
ok as a matter of fact this is the problem, I've just tested using ubuntu 2d with the laptop, and it works
so my question now is
how to enable 'toggle fullscreen' on ubuntu 3D?
My bet is, unity disables full-screen because of conflicts within compiz... I've found bugs about that already
unity 2D allows them though ... so maybe the conflict is not hard to solve
Because '2D' doesn't use all the fancy 3D compositing
See bug #1007352
